website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive Kevlar oven glove that comes in various cuff sizes to fit different users.
pros: Great price for this extremely protective oven glove
Flexible design makes handling food easy and gloves are comfortable to wear
Good for up to 480º F. Glove works for either the left hand or the right and provides a fair bit of coverage
cons: Glove is very large and is not sold as a pair

customer_reviews.title: Read the product description AND reviews to find out important info
customer_reviews.text: Nomex clothing is used by pilots, race car drivers and others who might be exposed to open flames for a brief period. Be sure to consider the weight of an object as well as the temperature. If you are dealing with heavy, very hot objects you might do better with leather welding gloves and an additional thermal pad. I was not surprised that there was only one glove but I was surprised that the max temp is rated at only 480 F. There are other gloves which are rated to almost 1,000 F. You might consider those if you do a lot of work with hot objects which are also heavy. I got what I paid for and am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Reid

customer_reviews.title: Sure do like this heat resistant glove
customer_reviews.text: Sure do like this heat resistant glove! It makes me feel safe when adding or rearranging wood in our woodstove. I typically do this with only 1 hand, so it's no problem to just have 1 glove. Actually makes it easier not to have to put on/take off 2. I can even pick up live coals with my glove-covered hand and not feel any heat at all. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Lincoln "Abe"

customer_reviews.title: Only one glove!! And it is GIANT!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I was extremely disappointed to learn this is only one glove. Additionally, it is HUGE! Which I suppose is beneficial for some (pro basketball players, Samoans, etc) but for an average adult hand, expect a loose fit. And for a small handed man or a woman... expect it to be too cumbersome to be useful. There should be sizes offered. Granted, I didn't actually try it on, for concern that if I took it apart from the packaging I may not be able to return it. Maybe if I put it on it would surprise me and fit like a glove?
customer_reviews.author: Review Reader

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are awesome! I use them when tending the fire in ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome! I use them when tending the fire in my wood stove, and I can't feel the heat through them. I bought one at first to see if it was good quality and quickly ordered a second glove after trying it out. Though I don't recommend holding onto a burning log, if one does roll out, you can easily catch it with the your hand while wearing the glove and put it back into the stove. So far holding up very well, a little dirty, but no tears, frets or melting after 3 months of continuous use
customer_reviews.author: OscarTheGrouch

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I had tried using work gloves but eventually a whole burns through - ouch. Its early days yet but this seems to be in a different league. Good insulation against the heat and shows no sign of charring. I happened to see a documentary about making pottery and noticed that the guy who operated the kiln seemed to have an identical pair of gloves. I just ordered one which I use on my dominant, right hand, The glove is truly ambidextrous so if/when it develops problems I can switch it to the left hand and use the other side. Why are Winter Gloves designed this way? Would make life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: UK2CA2SD

customer_reviews.title: Not a True Oven Glove
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for over a year now for camping. They are good for taking a coffee pot off the stove, reaching over a BBQ grill to flip a burger, or handling the hot handle/lid of a pot. The extended cuffs help when reaching into the oven, but if you grab a 425 degree cookie sheet out of the oven, you've got about ten seconds to figure out what where you're going to set it down.
customer_reviews.author: RoshEQ

customer_reviews.title: Still looks brand new!
customer_reviews.text: I forgot I bought this glove on Amazon in mid 2015. Started searching for G & F products and bingo. I highly recommend. Ditch all your oven mitts and buy 2 of these. First one from 2015 looks brand new-ish & as of today, second mitt acquired to use with my ninja air fryer. Totally protects against oven burns. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: D. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it has being so handy around my barbecue and oven! you can take anything out of the oven without risk of burning your hands. Also very useful when you're cleaning your barbecue between turns, when it is still hot as hell! Also you can switch between left or right hand, without a problem, it is the same both sides. I just dropped a star because it is not useful with hot liquids, you can still get burned with hot water (liquids) it is not waterproof...
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Muñoz

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Glove is soft and thick. It works for about half a minute before things get too hot to handle. Carrying things into the house from the grill takes about that long at a brisk walk. You only receive one glove, which I didn't realize because I was in a rush purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Necia N Campbell

customer_reviews.title: One-size fits all is not comfortable, has no hook for handing anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I have a large hand and find this glove a bit tight and difficult to put on. It works well once on but I have to look for the glove all over the kitchen (doesn't come with a hanging hook but a useless, cheap product tag not suitable as a handing point).
customer_reviews.author: Donald M. Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but don't pick up a burning log...
customer_reviews.text: Can be used on either hand. Appears to be well made and durable. The cuff is nice and long. UPDATE: Don't use to pick up burning logs. Burned right through. Good only for holding hot but not burning items. I thought Nomex was burn proof (as my firefighting gloves were), but apparently not. Bummer. Took off a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: High Standards for Online Purchases

customer_reviews.title: It works just don't order if you have very small hands
customer_reviews.text: Okay doing a fast edit here, it fits fine but doesn't "LOOK" like it would fit lol so buy if you have large or extreme large hands do not buy if you have tiny Timmy hands update I really like this one glove
customer_reviews.author: ∵¤§ãΐŋ†♣∀₦₲ξℜ◈∴

customer_reviews.title: Fingers 1" too short,  uncomfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: Fingers 1" too short, uncomfortable fit. Bought two to make a pair, don't use them as the fingers only go in to second finger joint and not up to the knuckle or webbing between fingers. The rest of the glove fits loose and sloppy. I don't have big hands and usually wear a large work glove size. Look elsewhere unless you have unusually short fingers.
customer_reviews.author: BErickson

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for the hand and wrist
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this comes one glove to a unit, but it can be used with either hand. The heat resistance is incredible. The surface of the glove itself gets quite warm if you're handling hot pans, but your hand won't sense it. As you may have guessed, the shiny elements seen in the photo are grips--in this case, they're very grippy. The sleeve or cuff (whatever you call it) also serves to protect your arm from heat and burns. It's way better than using a potholder or mitt when retrieving pans from the oven or holding a saucepan's handle. I absolutely recommend getting at least one of these gloves for anyone that cooks at all.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Way too big
customer_reviews.text: This glove was incredibly huge. I actually got 2, thinking I would need a pair. I do need a pair as I am constantly burning my hands learning to deal with a wood stove. Anyway, I guess I thought the generic size would fit my hand but I was wrong. Width-wise it was okay but the fingers were too long. No way to tell this from the description or measurements, at least not that I saw. Returning both gloves.
customer_reviews.author: bambooblue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heat glove
customer_reviews.text: I love this better than my homemade potholders I made with ensel bright fabric that helps with picking up hot items. This is a great gift for anyone who cooks. This is the second one I bought. Love it. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come as a pair, as you would expect
customer_reviews.text: They only reason it's 2 stars is because it's sold by piece. In other words you order just 1 glove. I realized that once I received the first one so I had to order the second one... It's like selling just one sock! Gloves should come in pairs. Other than that it looks ok.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Keeper
customer_reviews.text: Works well and hard to misplace color. I like that it has a higher wrist on it than most. We use it camping w/ others, no need to put a name on this puppy. I have others I paid double for that are not better. I wish it came in 2's at slightly higher price. But I always have 5 left handed around, as I always the loss the right hand mate.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guy and I have large hands. I ordered two of these gloves. Sadly, only one fit. The other was so small that I could not fit my fingers in the glove. I returned them and Amazon sent me another glove. This glove's fingers were too short. Oddly short, in fact. I could get only half the length of my fingers into the fingers of the gloves before they'd hit the tips. The quality control and length of these gloves varies greatly. So out of three gloves, one fits me. The small Webergloves were far too small, and the L/XL Weber 6670 Glove Set were too large. These are the only gloves---well, one anyway--that have fit so far.
customer_reviews.author: Zapper45

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my husband when we bought a house with a woodstove. That was two years ago, he used them for every single fire we have, and they are still in GREAT shape. They work perfectly for opening the doors when the handle gets hot and sticking your hands in to put a log on the burning fire. I can stick my hand straight onto the hot stove and not feel a thing, they really do work.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Perry

customer_reviews.title: It did what I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for moving logs around in the campfire. You can feel the sensation of heat start to transfer if you hang on to long. The rubber like coating started to melt in a few spots on mine. I have sm/med size female hands and they fit fine. I'm not sure these would fit a big guy though. I'd buy a different brand over buying a second one of these if I decide to get another glove.
customer_reviews.author: Gamermomstl

customer_reviews.title: protects hands, price, mobility and dexterity is still good.
customer_reviews.text: great for working on grill. does shield from heat and fire. sicilcone gloves are good too, but too rigid and you lose a lot of dexterity and mobility. these maintain both and provide equal amount of protection. use it ALL THE TIME during the summer and as held up well. a definite must if you grill and are a bbq master. pro - price, protects, maintain mobility and dexterity con - will have to replace, fraying around edges and pretty dirty after 1 years use. my fault
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works great for quick in and out or flipping on the grill. Don’t try to carry a hot dish across the room with it though. You’ll get burnt Also it’s huge for me but fit by bfs hand good.
customer_reviews.author: Cece 🤗

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I have had one for several years that I take on camping trips and it is a life saver. I am an average size person with small to medium size hands. I do not feel a thing in this glove when reaching near flame and when holding hot pans and pots, even when they are boiling over. I have washed it and it still works great. The cuff is long for nice protection. I just bought a 2nd one to keep in my emergency grab bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The glove fits nice but is not durable. I purchased 2 gloves and they both wore out in the thumbs. The gloves did not last, not even for 1 season. Will not purchase again. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: The Judge

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect lesson of making sure you read everything before you ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect lesson of making sure you read everything before you buy. I understood this as the cuff measuring up, but the mitts length starts at the tip of the middle finger and was much too short for my husband to wear when putting wood in our wood burning fireplace insert. The material does give some your skin heat protection it’s where covered but the little fibers smolder a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wittekind

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant Glove, bought it to transfer hot coals from the chimney starter to the pitbarrel, and it does just that without feeling the heat, my hand is often 2-3cm from a red burning coal, and often i had to pick up one that just fell out (my advice is don't hang to it too long as eventually you will feel it).

customer_reviews.title: Decent grilling glove

These aren't heat proof and there are times when I'm holding the grate for too long and I can feel the heat through the tips. All in all they are useful for grilling
customer_reviews.author: G. House

customer_reviews.title: In General is OK.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second glove. The first one get lost when we moved to a new house. It work as expected but my only complaint is that it got a bad smell and I need to wash it more frequently and also is more difficult to put it on on my hand, my finger get stuck at half of the way. I do a lot of BBQ, so for my is very import to use this kind of glove to let me grill without burn my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Luis Rivero Perez

customer_reviews.title: Hot item. Great Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these gloves for backyard foundry work. I melt aluminum in a crucible, and whenever I remove the crucible with tongs, I wear these gloves. Heat has never been a problem with these gloves (for my hands). I have also used them to remove pans from the oven. I would not recommend wearing these gloves nor putting them in fire. Follow the heat ranges in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Dennimen

customer_reviews.title: This glove did not protect me from pulling a baking ...
customer_reviews.text: This glove did not protect me from pulling a baking sheet out of the oven at 415F. I'm throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like this one
customer_reviews.text: Not very good with heat. Plus...I didn’t realize that you only receive ONE glove per order. I won’t bother ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great Single Glove
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. I thought I was getting two but it is only one. I was disappointed but it protects from heat when grilling or lifting dutch oven lids or moving the oven. You only need one for those things.
customer_reviews.author: R. Allred

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this mitt. It is good quality. I like how thick it is and how high it goes up on the arm. I tried it when pulling out a hot pizza stone and other things from the oven and it worked great. The material is stretchy, which helps make a good fit. Overall, I am impressed with this mitt and would highly recommend it. This product review is based on the practical use of a complimentary copy of the product itself in the form of honesty and most accurate opinion to the best of my knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Alison S Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best oven mitt
customer_reviews.text: These things are the best oven mitts you can buy. Stop buying the big bulky ones are get some of these. They can handle pretty high heat for how thin they are. They last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best Glove Ever!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pieces of camping equipment I have ever bought. Once my friends see that I have this glove, as soon as they get home from our camping trip, go out and buy a couple of them. With these gloves, please keep in mind that you shouldn't keep your hand directly in the fire for an extended period of time. I mainly use this for moving the logs around in the fire and stoking. Also great for removing pots/pans that you may use in the fire as well.
customer_reviews.author: CaliJester

customer_reviews.title: Love Hate
customer_reviews.text: Totally missed the fact that the price is for 1 single glove. My mistake when ordering. But I do like the glove.
customer_reviews.author: N E

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you like to smoke or cook with wood
customer_reviews.text: This works great, you can hold on to something extremely hot for about 6 or 7 seconds before the heat will begin to make it through the glove. Easy to wash, I’ve had mine for over a year and I use it every time I grill or smoke
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value. I often buy the ove gloves for the kitchen and camp fires, but my husband was taking them for the woodstove and being white they were turning black. Got these for him for Xmas. He has big hands and they fit well. The regular cuff is long. The black doesn't show all the soot. We are able to take the ash tray out without burning our hands. Half the price of the ove gloves!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No More Burns
customer_reviews.text: We like ours so much we bought 4 more for gifts. Great for fire pits, outdoor grilling, and cooking in general.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Don’t judge a book by its cover
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about it being resistant to very hot items. I picked up my smoker stone and to my surprise I didn’t get burnt nor did I smell anything melting. I believe I’m going to have to buy me another one so I can use both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley A.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading name, uncomfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Should be labeled heat resistant glove, not gloves. That's misleading... The fit is extremely poor, the thumb is very short and the palm is super baggy. Would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FlexibleToast

customer_reviews.title: Single glove only
customer_reviews.text: This says gloveS multiple times, however it should read glove. This is one glove only. I was hoping for fire service quality gloves that you can use to hold burning wood, but this can’t even hold a cast iron skillet coming out from under a hot broiler. If I had more time in my schedule, I would have returned them and found something more heat resistant. Ok for cooking if you want an oven not that is a pain in the @$$ to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Fam of 4

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for the competetors
customer_reviews.text: First use was to grab the handles of a large pan I had been using to cook stir fry. No idea how hot the handles were but the golve melted and I got a rather nasty burn across two fingers. Grabbed a standard oven mitt to finish the job and it had no problems. Complete waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fishback

customer_reviews.title: One size does not fit all!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do what they are intended for very well. I used them to adjust the vents and to place a tray of food on the lower rack on a hot bullet shaped water smoker and then again to take it out. My only problem with them is that the description states one size fits all. If you have large hands like I do you will have problems also. I was able to force my hands in the gloves but when they are stretched too far ( I couldn't get my fingers all the way in ) the heat comes right through the seams on the sides of the fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great for homebrewing
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I got 2 for homebrewing, as I often have to lift hot pots and be near flames and got tired of always having to run in the house and find a potholder at the worst possible time. I was able to pick up very hot metal with these and not feel a thing. Only complaint is the cut of them. They're designed I guess to be for either hand, but in the end they sit awkwardly on your hand. It doesn't really impact their usability, but when you put them on they just don't feel exactly right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fireplace, Wood stoves, Grills, Cast Iron cookware- does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband as a part of his grill christmas present. We use alot of cast iron cookware and our grill tops are also cast iron so I wanted something he could use to move/adjust/clean all those things with while hot without a chance of serious burns. This glove works amazing for that! He's also used it in our big old cast iron wood stove to move logs around or put in new ones and it worked great as well, but that was very short term in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Eldredge

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: No more burns for this girl! I'm terrible about cutting or burning myself frequently in the kitchen- this glove prevents all of that. It takes an extra moment to put on (rather than just grabbing a towel) but works great. The glove also makes it easier to still function compared to the mitt. Perfect for hot potatoes, pans, etc etc .
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great product, however other customers use the plural pronoun ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, however other customers use the plural pronoun "these", be aware when buying "this" is one glove - singular. At first I though I was missing one but after thoroughly reading the description it clearly states "item: 1". I guess that is on me. But overall, great item for keeping your hands and wrist away from the heat and safe from burns while stilling giving good mobility of your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Language In the Ad
customer_reviews.text: Only 1 glove arrived. Some of the photos in the main ad clearly show a pair. The description says 1 item, but I interpreted this as 1 pair. Other customers talk about receiving a pair of gloves in their reviews. Who in the hell sells only a single item of things typically sold in pairs? Could you imagine ordering what you thought was a pair of socks or shoes and only getting one half of the pair? What gives? Other than that it works well and blocks out heat for when throwing wood into my cast iron wood burning stove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as another pair of heat resistant gloves I owned ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as another pair of heat resistant gloves I owned (can't think of the brand right now), but overall, they perform well. The disadvantages relative to the other pair I owned are that these gloves do not protect you hands from the heat for as long and the grip material seems to melt a little. But they do the job as long as you do not hold the hot item for an extended period. I like the black too as it conceals stains better.
customer_reviews.author: TW990

customer_reviews.title: One of two is 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these mitts, I really like them for what I use them for (BBQ/Smoking Food). I have not had any issues with them keeping my hands from being burned, my cooker runs about 310 so any temps above that I cannot comment on. One problem I do have is that one of the mitts does not have the liner that is connected, meaning, when I take the mitt off, the inside liner comes out of the mitt, not a huge deal, but it is annoying. If both mitts were the same this would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bada Bing

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Glove for Playing with Fire
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this almost daily since I got it when I have a fire going in the house. I can pick up logs while they're on fire and put them back on the pile. I plan on buying more of these for myself and others. Very comfortable glove too. You can start to feel the heat after a little bit of contact with the fire, but as long as you're able to use a little common sense, then these will be a great asset to anyone with a fireplace or who burns brush piles outside.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Just one glove?
customer_reviews.text: One glove? Really? Who sends one glove. Guess I didn’t read the fine print but I assumed gloves come in pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Max Auerbach

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a solid buy for the price. You only get the one glove, but that's all I need to load firewood in a burning stove. I tested the glove by holding it right in the flames - I could definitely feel it getting warmer but the material did not show any signs of singeing, and its not designed to be totally fire proof anyway. For loading firewood in your stove, a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: We have a side-load soapstone stove, and sometimes it is difficult to adjust logs using the poker. WIth this glove, I can reach in, grab the smoldering log, and put it where I want it! It works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: TammyH

customer_reviews.title: My favorite oven mitt of all time
customer_reviews.text: Slips on in 2 seconds with no trouble, completely heat proof for me so far, lots of flexibility and grip, first time I've used a true oven proof glove instead of mitt. I'm ordering a couple more and tossing the other ones in the drawer. My wife who has much smaller hands feels the same way about it. One minor tip, the silicone dots stay pretty warm for a minute or so after you use it. The first time I used it I set the pan down and grabbed the glove to pull it off and it was pretty hot! Not hot enough to burn, but it startled me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Hot potatoes are no problem.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for camping, and I am able to grab hot pots, foil packs, and cans right out of the fire or off a grill grate without getting burned or scorched.
customer_reviews.author: JJW

customer_reviews.title: Just left E.R. because of gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: Just left E.R. with 2nd degree burns, lifted a baking pan out of the oven and these gloves were no help at all, they were like wearing a winter glove, heat went right though the gloves, yes I bought 2, and fried my fingers seriously bad, oven was only set at 375, cannot believe Amazon is shipping these on Prime!!
customer_reviews.author: Shayne Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Snug Fitting
customer_reviews.text: It's not as big as I expected it to be. I've got small-to-average hands for a man and this glove barely fits. As far as keeping your hands safe from heat, I've used them to remove the grill grate to add more charcoal to the grill with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: B and V

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I do a lot of BBQ so i decided to give it a try. First of all I have to say its very comfortable and it fits perfectly fine. Then, I feel nothing when using them. Be aware though, fire has a temperature that could reach way more than 1000o F, so try not to touch fire or carbon. Also, you'll need to buy 2 if you want a pair. This item is for just one globe. Fortunately I could try it out before I purchased a seconds one. Great value. Just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Fito

customer_reviews.title: great for a cook!
customer_reviews.text: i work as a cook in a kitchen and this works great for my saute pans. my only issue is that when i have a pan on the back burner and flames hit the handle for a while the heat goes through the glove, not bad when i drop it but i cant hold it for long periods of time but besides that i pull stuff out of my oven just fine and i always use to to brick my flat top not more accidentally slipping and punching the flat top when it happens i cant feel a thing and i just keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Lerschykisses

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility comes in large size
customer_reviews.text: A glove gives you much more flexibility, so that's useful. The donwside is that the glove only comes in one size, and even though I have medium-to-big hands, it still feels too big.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: We have a fireplace in our apartment and thought this would be great to be able to feed wood
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my boyfriend. We have a fireplace in our apartment and thought this would be great to be able to feed wood. It is! He and I both use this glove. It seems a little weird at first, we thought, "just one glove?" but honestly it's all we've needed. We're not trying to play with the fire, just get close enough to place wood in to keep the fire going. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: K Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Torture Tested
customer_reviews.text: I left my hand on the electric burner ( glass top stove) while it heated to the high setting until the glove started to smell funny. It was maybe 20-30 seconds. My palm was starting to get uncomfortably warm but no burns. Note: this glove is made in China. Note: you only get 1 glove with the order.
customer_reviews.author: PhilAnders

customer_reviews.title: Good... BIG... but Good!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the glove. The only problem is that it is so big. I have small hands. I couldn't find a smaller glove anywhere. I bought this so I could hold on to my hot jars when I am canning. It works well and isn't slippery, just wish I could find one that fits me better than it fits my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Babopp

customer_reviews.title: Ok glove.

product_meta.title: G & F 1682 Dupont Nomex Heat Resistant gloves for cooking, grilling, fireplace and oven, Barbecue Pit Mitt, BBQ Gloves, Sold by 1 Piece
product_meta.description:
Size:Regular Cuff (12.5")This heat-resistant fireplace & barbecue pit mitt is flexible, provides grip on all fingers & can withstand extreme heat & even an occasional flame. It is perfect for indoor or outdoor use, for the oven, grill, Stovetop & the barbecue.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Heat Resistant Fireplace and Barbecue Pit Mitt is flexible, provides all fingers grip, can withstand extreme heat and even an occasional flame. Perfect for indoor or outdoor use, for the oven, grill, stovetop, barbecue. Made of Aramid on the exterior and double knit cotton on the interior, this mitt fits like a glove. Do not uses wet as water would transmit heat to the inside of the glove. Aramid is a man made textile with amazing heat protection characteristics. It is used by race car drivers, astronauts, fire fighters as well as jet fighter pilots whose survival depends not only on skills, but also proper equipment. Although aramid could burn when a flame is held up to it, the glove will stop burning as soon as the heat source is removed, which illustrate its flame resistant property. Aramid arranged in a thick woven structure is also a poor conductor of heat, which makes it the perfect oven glove material. Machine washable, dry flat, do not bleach.
